activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
The defendant April M. Wayman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. April M. Wayman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • April M. Wayman was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

3:28 p.m. Defendant April M. Wayman in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Plea questionaire filed. Ferguson enters no contest plea to Count 2.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Ferguson/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court imposes costs only. Special disposition under Section 973.015 appropriate if all costs are paid in full by due date. Appeal rights given.  Review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Called Amy at ONSO to cancel warrant due to voluntary appearance - Warrant not yet at ONSO

1:33 p.m. Court Commissioner Kirk Reese for Judge Bloom. Defendant April M. Wayman in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Ferguson states that defendant forgot appearance date on 08-04-15 but agreement has been reached with State. Court quashes warrant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 03:30 pm. Adj. 1:35 p.m.

2:56 pm. Attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ferguson states agreement reached - does not know why defendant did not appear.  State moves to issue warrant.  Court authorizes. Adj. 257 p.m.
Notified Brandi - made VA in court -

01:39 pm - Defendant April M. Wayman in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions as to non-appearance on June 9th.  Ferguson states the defendant contacted the BR II JA regarding rescheduling of the June 9th date.  Court quashes warrant.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

03:05 pm - Attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ferguson states a plea agreement had been reached - does not know why defendant is not present.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:13 pm - Defendant April M. Wayman in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

02:38 pm - Defendant April M. Wayman in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD/obtain counsel,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
